node.title: Christchurch mayor to mark earthquake anniversary with video message
node.description: At nine-minutes to 1PM today, it will be 11 years since a devastating earthquake struck Canterbury, killing 185 people.
node.content:
["At nine-minutes to 1PM today, it will be 11 years since a devastating earthquake struck Canterbury, killing 185 people.", "", "
The 185 empty chairs memorial for the victims of the 2011 Christchurch earthquake. File photo Photo: RNZ / Conan Young
", "Covid-19 measures saw this year's public gathering in Ōtautahi scrapped, with the mayor Lianne Dalziel instead laying a wreath at the city's Memorial Wall and reading the names of the dead aloud.", "A live civic service traditionally marks the moment the quake struck with a minute of silence but Dalziel's address was pre-recorded this morning as whānau of the victims marked the anniversary privately.", "A council spokesperson says the video of the mayor's address will be online in time to mark the minute of silence."]
